snippet: Second-quarter revenue came in below expectations and investors focused on slower growth. Shares lost 27 percent on Tuesday.
abstract: Shares of Groupon fall almost 20 percent in after-hours trading as second-quarter revenue comes in below expectations and investors focus on slower growth; net income was $28.4 million, or 4 cents a share, compared with loss of $107.4 million in year-ago quarter; revenue was $568.3 million, up 45 percent, but analysts had expected $573 million.
lead_paragraph: Second-quarter revenue came in below expectations and investors focused on slower growth. Shares lost 27 percent on Tuesday.

headline.seo: Groupon Posts Mixed Results and Stock Falls
headline.main: Groupon Posts Mixed Results, and Stock Falls
headline.print_headline: Groupon’s Shares Fall on Results, Joining Zynga and Facebook in a Decline
